Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of expression and is contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, specifically Article 19.
The bill lacks mechanisms to protect valid expression of opinion and belief.
It grants excessive power to unelected bureaucrats, lacking transparency and accountability.
The bill creates inequality before the law, allowing government and official news channels more freedom than the general public.
The bill could lead to government oppression and suppression of public will.
The government and mainstream media are seen as the main promoters of misinformation and disinformation.
Questions the ability of ACMA to determine 'truth' and thus define 'misinformation' and 'disinformation'.
Main Themes: Role of Government and Media in Misinformation
Notable Quotes: It is my will that it should be dismissed.
This Bill is an infringement and limitation on my rights, and those of we the people, to freedom of expression.
The greatest promoters of disinformation and misinformation is the Government and the Mainstream Media.
